qas.question: How many brigades does the Army consist of?
Each Brigade contains how many regiments?
What squadron is present but not an official part of the Brigade?
What medical group is present at all Brigades but not part of it?
How many brigades does the non-Army consist of?

What squadron is present but is an official part of the Brigade?

context: Currently, the Regular Force comp<a1_0>one<a1_0/>nt of the Army consists of <a0_0><b4_0>three<b4_0/><a0_0/> field-ready brigade groups: 1 Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group, at CFB Edmonton and CFB Shilo; 2 Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group, at CFB Petawawa and CFB Gagetown; and 5 Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group, at CFB Valcartier and Quebec City. Each contains one regiment each of artillery, armour, and combat engineers, three battalions of infantry (all scaled in the British fashion), <b5_0>one<b5_0/> battalion for logistics, a squadron for headquarters/signals, and several smaller support organizations. A <a2_0><b6_0>tactical helicopter squadron<b6_0/><a2_0/> and <a3_0>a <b7_0>field ambulance<b7_0/><a3_0/> are co-located with each brigade, but do not form part of the brigade's command structure.
